page.title: 15Farming (3) Dairy, Bowness.
page.content: For{Dairy}farmers the year begins when the cows are let out of their winter quarters or{Shippon.}The calves are usually born in the spring.A few hours after calving the calf is taken away from its mother before the cow gets too attached to her calf. When you are feeding the calf you must feed it on its mother's fresh milk.There is one main danger to a cow and that is{Milk {Fever.}This means that the cow cannot be milked and you could lose the cow. The cure is to feed your cow{calcium} by using a needle and sticking it into a vein. Summer is very much like spring in that calves are being born and even more milk is being produced because the grass is so lush. In winter the cows are brought in again to the{shippon}and fed on{silage that was made in the summer.
